sen.j: 意富富杼王（おおほどのおおきみ、生没年不詳）は、『古事記』・「上宮記」に伝えられる古墳時代の皇族（王族）。
sen.e: Prince Ohodo [Ohodo no Okimi (意富富杼王); his date of birth and death were unknown] appeared in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and the "Joguki" (Record of the Crown Prince) as an Imperial family (royal family) during the Kofu period (tumulus period).

Prince Ohodo (Ohodo no Okimi; his date of birth and death were unknown) appeared in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and the 'Joguki' (Record of the Crown Prince) as an Imperial family (royal family) during the Kofun period (tumulus period).
sen.cmt: Kofu→Kofun, ()と[]の変更をしました。
sen.e: Prince Ohodo (Ohodo no Okimi; his date of birth and death were unknown) appeared in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and the 'Joguki' (Record of the Crown Prince) as an Imperial family (royal family) during the Kofun period (tumulus period).

sen.j: 大郎子（おおいらつこ）、意富々杼王、意富富等王、大大迹王とも。
sen.e: Prince Ohodo (意富富杼王) was also known as; 'Oiratsuko' (大郎子), 'Ohod no Miko' (意富々杼王), 'Ohodo no Kimi' (意富富等王), and 'Ohodo no Kimi' (大大迹王).
Prince Ohodo was also known as; Oiratsuki, Ohod no Miko, Ohodo no Kimi, and Ohodo no Kimi.
sen.cmt: シングルクオートの削除しました。
sen.e: Prince Ohodo was also known as; Oiratsuki, Ohod no Miko, Ohodo no Kimi, and Ohodo no Kimi.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 父は稚渟毛二派皇子（応神天皇の皇子）、母は河派仲彦王の女・弟日売真若比売（おとひめまわかひめ、百師木伊呂弁とも）である。
sen.e: The father of Prince Ohodo was 'Wakanuke no Futamata no Miko' [(稚渟毛二派皇子); a prince of the Emperor Ojin]; and the mother of Prince Ohodo was 'Otohime Mawakahime [(弟日売真若比売); also known as 'Momoshiki no Irobe' (百師木伊呂弁)] who was a daughter of 'Kawamata Nakatsuhiko' (河派仲彦).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The father of Prince Ohodo was Wakanuke no Futamata no Miko (a prince of the Emperor Ojin); and the mother of Prince Ohodo was Otohime Mawakahime (also known as Momoshiki no Irobe who was a daughter of Kawamata Nakatsuhiko).
sen.cmt: ()と[]の変更をしました。
sen.e: The father of Prince Ohodo was Wakanuke no Futamata no Miko (a prince of the Emperor Ojin); and the mother of Prince Ohodo was Otohime Mawakahime (also known as Momoshiki no Irobe who was a daughter of Kawamata Nakatsuhiko).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同母妹の忍坂大中姫・衣通姫は允恭天皇に入内している。
sen.e: The half maternal sisters of Prince Ohodo were Oshisakano onakatsunohimeno Mikoto (忍坂大中姫) and 'Sotoorihime' (衣通姫), each of them became a judai (As an Imperial bride, a daughter of nobles or royal family whose entered into the Imperial court.) to the Emperor Ingyo's court.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The half maternal sisters of Prince Ohodo were Oshisakano onakatsunohimeno Mikoto and Sotoorihime, each of them became a judai (As an Imperial bride, a daughter of nobles or royal family whose entered into the Imperial court.) to the Emperor Ingyo's court.
sen.cmt: シングルクオートの削除しました。
sen.e: The half maternal sisters of Prince Ohodo were Oshisakano onakatsunohimeno Mikoto and Sotoorihime, each of them became a judai (As an Imperial bride, a daughter of nobles or royal family whose entered into the Imperial court.) to the Emperor Ingyo's court.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 意富富杼王自身の詳しい事績は伝わらないが、『古事記』には息長坂君（息長君・坂田君か）・酒人君・三国君・筑紫米多君（めたのきみ）などの祖としている。
sen.e: There was a lack of episodes of achievement and recorded written events on Prince Ohodo; he was described as an ancestor of: 'Okinaga no Saka no Kimi' [(息長坂君), a possibly combined two names: 'Okinaga no Kimi' (息長君) and 'Sakata no Kimi' (坂田君)], 'Sakahito no Kimi' (酒人君), 'Mikuni no Kimi' (三国君), 'Tsukushinometa no Kimi' (筑紫米多君), and others in the "Kojiki."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There was a lack of episodes of achievement and recorded written events on Prince Ohodo; he was described as an ancestor of: Okinaga no Saka no Kimi (a possibly combined two names: Okinaga no Kimi and Sakata no Kimi), Sakahito no Kimi, Mikuni no Kimi, Tsukushinometa no Kimi, and others in the Kojiki.
sen.cmt: ()と[]の変更をしました。
sen.e: There was a lack of episodes of achievement and recorded written events on Prince Ohodo; he was described as an ancestor of: Okinaga no Saka no Kimi (a possibly combined two names: Okinaga no Kimi and Sakata no Kimi), Sakahito no Kimi, Mikuni no Kimi, Tsukushinometa no Kimi, and others in the Kojiki.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また「上宮記」逸文の文章系譜によれば、中斯知命（なかしちのみこと）を妃として乎非王（おいのおおきみ）を儲け、その孫が男大迹王（袁本杼王）すなわち継体天皇とされる。
sen.e: Further more, according to the Itsubun (unidentified or lost wirings) written genealogy from the "Joguki," Prince Ohodo married 'Nakashichi no Mikoto' (中斯知命) taking her as his princess, and they had a son (prince), 'Oi no Okimi' (乎非王).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, according to the Itsubun (unidentified or lost wirings) written genealogy from the 'Joguki,' Prince Ohodo married Nakashichi no Mikoto taking her as his princess, and they had a son (prince), Oi no Okimi.
sen.cmt: Furthermoreの訂正、シングルクオートの削除しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, according to the Itsubun (unidentified or lost wirings) written genealogy from the 'Joguki,' Prince Ohodo married Nakashichi no Mikoto taking her as his princess, and they had a son (prince), Oi no Okimi.

sen.j: その孫が男大迹王（袁本杼王）すなわち継体天皇とされる。
sen.e: Later, his grandson was Prince Odo [Odo no Kimi (男大迹王); also known as 'Odo no Mikoto (袁本杼王)'], in other words, the Emperor Keitai.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Later, his grandson was Prince Odo (Odo no Kimi); also known as Odo no Mikoto, in other words, the Emperor Keitai.
sen.cmt: ()と[]の変更、シングルクオートの削除しました。
sen.e: Later, his grandson was Prince Odo (Odo no Kimi); also known as Odo no Mikoto, in other words, the Emperor Keitai.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 近年の研究では、継体天皇即位の正当性を示すために系譜作成の段階で挿入された人物としてその実在性を疑われている。
sen.e: In recent research and historical study, doubt was cast on the existence of Prince Ohodo; this was effected in the belief of some scholars that Prince Ohodo was an implant; being a fictitious person inserted during the process of creating the genealogy tables, in an attempt to show the legitimacy in the enthronement of the Emperor Keitai.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In recent research and historical study, doubt was cast on the existence of Prince Ohodo; this was effected in the belief of some scholars that Prince Ohodo was an implant; being a fictitious person inserted during the process of creating the genealogy tables, in an attempt to show the legitimacy in the enthronement of the Emperor Keitai.
sen.cmt: スペース訂正しました。
sen.e: In recent research and historical study, doubt was cast on the existence of Prince Ohodo; this was effected in the belief of some scholars that Prince Ohodo was an implant; being a fictitious person inserted during the process of creating the genealogy tables, in an attempt to show the legitimacy in the enthronement of the Emperor Keitai.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、「意富富杼（おほほど）＝大ホド」は継体の「袁本杼＝小ホド」と対応する名であることから、本来の系譜には継体の兄として位置付けられていた可能性もある。
sen.e: However, since the written characters of Prince Ohodo, "Ohodo (意富富杼) meant large hodo," correspond to the characters of Keitai, "Ohodo (袁本杼) meaning small hodo;" the possibility remains that Prince Ohodo (意富富杼王) was positioned as an elder brother of Keitai in the original genealogy table.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, since the written characters of Prince Ohodo, '意富富杼' (Ohodo meaning large hodo), correspond to the characters of Keitai, '袁本杼' (Ohoso meaning small hodo), the possibility remains that Prince Ohodo was positioned as an elder brother of Keitai in the original genealogy table.
sen.cmt: ダブルクォート→ダブルクォートの変更をしました。
sen.e: However, since the written characters of Prince Ohodo, '意富富杼' (Ohodo meaning large hodo), correspond to the characters of Keitai, '袁本杼' (Ohoso meaning small hodo), the possibility remains that Prince Ohodo was positioned as an elder brother of Keitai in the original genealogy table.
sen.cmt: ‘ ’→ ' 'スペース調整

sen.j: 意富(おう)は意宇、於宇、大、太、多と古書に登場する。
sen.e: Additionally, "O (意富)" this appeared in different written characters in old (ancient) books, such as; "O (意宇)," "O (於宇)," "O (大)," "O (太)," and "O (多)."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Additionally, O (意富) appears in different written characters in ancient books, such as; O (意宇), O (於宇), O (大), O (太) and O (多).
sen.cmt: thisとダブルクオートを削除し、appearedを現在形にしました。
sen.e: Additionally, O (意富) appears in different written characters in ancient books, such as; O (意宇), O (於宇), O (大), O (太) and O (多).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: それに、出雲国東部を本貫とする大国主命を氏神とする一族との関連性も伺わせる。
sen.e: Because of this consideration, Prince Ohodo (意富富杼王) might have had a relationship with the clans who worshiped 'Okuninushi no Mikoto' [(大国主命); chief god of Izumo from the southern Honshu Island, Japan, and the central character in the important cycle of myths established in that region] whose birthplace was in the eastern part of the Izumo Province, as their ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Because of this consideration, Prince Ohodo (意富富杼王) might have had a relationship with the clans who worshiped Okuninushi no Mikoto (大国主命; chief god of Izumo from the southern Honshu Island, Japan, and the central character in the important cycle of myths established in that region) whose birthplace was in the eastern part of Izumo Province, as their ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion).
sen.cmt: the Izumo Province→ Izumo Province、[]の削除しました。
sen.e: Because of this consideration, Prince Ohodo (意富富杼王) might have had a relationship with the clans who worshiped Okuninushi no Mikoto (大国主命; chief god of Izumo from the southern Honshu Island, Japan, and the central character in the important cycle of myths established in that region) whose birthplace was in the eastern part of Izumo Province, as their ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
